burst.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: if something bursts, or if you burst it, it breaks open or apart suddenly and violently so that its contents come out
burst.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The pipes had burst and the house was under two feet of water.
burst.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to move somewhere suddenly or quickly, especially into or out of a place
burst.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: the act of something bursting or the place where it has burst
burst.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: a burst in the water pipe
burst.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a short sudden effort or increase in activity
burst.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The van gave a sudden burst of speed.
burst.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: a short sudden and usually loud sound
burst.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: sharp bursts of machine gun fire
burst.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: a sudden strong feeling or emotion
